page.title: 01Overall View of the grid.
page.content: The area covered by the grid reference 03640087 is largely agricultural land. It has only one settlement of significance- the village of Martinstown, the population of which is increasing due to housing developments over the last six years. The village is a linear one, following the South Winterborne and the B3159 for approximatley 1 kilometre West to East. The other important aspect of the area is Maiden Castle, a large Iron Age hill fort, whose future role at the time of writing is very much in the balance. More information may be found by consulting the English Heritage Commission.The main A354 road from Dorchester to Weymouth passes through the bottom Eastern corner of the area close to Winterborne Monkton a tiny settlement consisting of a farm
